page.title: 01Rural Hills in West Somerset
page.content: The block comprises farms and villages, located throughout hilly countryside, gen over mostly to sheep grasing but with some cattle. Tolland i a small community with a 13th Century church set apart on a mound. Brompton Ralph as a memorial cross infront of the church which commemorates those who died in the 1914-18 war, it also has a post office and village hall. Elworthy has its own church, but no other amenities. Willet Hill is owned by the forestry Comission and is mostly covered by coniferous forest. Willet Tower is an ancient square tower now a ruin, at the top of Willet Hill. Harthrow manor and Willet House are privately owned residences not open to the public. Rook's nest is a farm to the west of Willet Hill and Knights is also the name of a farm.
